title: 107_s2916
content: The Act is titled the "Tuition Assistance for Families Act" and includes an expansion of tuition tax deduction. The "Tuition Assistance for Families Act" includes amendments to dollar limitations for adjusted gross income in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Tuition Assistance for Families Act" amends dollar limitations for adjusted gross income in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For taxable years after 2003, dollar amounts are adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year, with rounding rules applied. The "Tuition Assistance for Families Act" adjusts dollar amounts for adjusted gross income in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amounts not multiples of $100 are rounded down. Section 222 regarding qualified tuition and related expenses is permanently amended. These changes apply to payments made after December 31, 2002. Expansion of Lifetime Learning Credit. Expansion of Lifetime Learning Credit. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code increases the per taxpayer credit from 20% to 25% and raises the dollar limitation from $10,000 to $12,000. Inflation adjustments will also increase the dollar amount for the lifetime learning credit in taxable years after 2003. The amendments made by this section increase the dollar amount for the lifetime learning credit in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN INCOME LIMITS FOR HOPE AND LIFETIME LEARNING CREDITS. The income limits for the Hope and Lifetime Learning Credits are increased to $55,000 ($110,000). Amendments apply to payments made after December 31, 2002. The Department of Education Appropriations Act, 2002 is amended to increase the maximum Pell Grant awards from $4,000 to $4,500. Additionally, academic achievement scholarships are established. The Department of Education Appropriations Act, 2002 is amended to increase Pell Grant awards to $4,500 and establish academic achievement scholarships of $1,000 for top 5% high school graduates to cover higher education costs. The Department of Education Appropriations Act, 2002 is amended to increase Pell Grant awards to $4,500 and establish academic achievement scholarships of $1,000 for top 5% high school graduates to cover higher education costs. Scholarships awarded under this section will be allocated to both public and private school students based on regulations set by the Secretary of Education. The Department of Education Appropriations Act, 2002 is amended to increase Pell Grant awards to $4,500 and establish academic achievement scholarships of $1,000 for top 5% high school graduates. Scholarships will be allocated to both public and private school students. Definitions for 'cost of attendance' and 'institution of higher education' are provided in this section.
